Tutorial.CSR.Env_register¬∂

Policy search module uses A BanditCSREnv to register a base environment.

Code Size Reduction Environment Classes:

  • BanditCSREnv

BanditCSREnv¬∂

class compiler_gym.envs.optimization.BanditCSREnv(policy, data)[source]¬∂

we formulate RL component search as a multi-armed bandit (MAB) problem.

Observation:

Type: Box(20) By default, the meta-optimizer runs each client RL for past few exploration

steps during a trial to allow it to converge before taking the observation. We use the 20 most recently chosen policy architectures as the state. Actions:

Type: Discrete(n) Given a budget of ùëõ candidate RL component configurations (or slot machines)

Reward:

We then use the most frequently chosen policy architecture as the outcome of policy search.

close()[source]¬∂

Override close in your subclass to perform any necessary cleanup.

Environments will automatically close() themselves when garbage collected or when the program exits.

generate_reward(action)[source]¬∂

feedback the reward.

get_observation(action)[source]¬∂

feedback the observation.

render(mode='human', close=False)[source]¬∂

Renders the environment.

The set of supported modes varies per environment. (And some environments do not support rendering at all.) By convention, if mode is:

  • human: render to the current display or terminal and return nothing. Usually for human consumption.

  • rgb_array: Return an numpy.ndarray with shape (x, y, 3), representing RGB values for an x-by-y pixel image, suitable for turning into a video.

  • ansi: Return a string (str) or StringIO.StringIO containing a terminal-style text representation. The text can include newlines and ANSI escape sequences (e.g. for colors).

Note

Make sure that your class‚Äôs metadata ‚Äòrender.modes‚Äô key includes

the list of supported modes. It‚Äôs recommended to call super() in implementations to use the functionality of this method.

Parameters

mode (str) ‚Äì the mode to render with

Example:

class MyEnv(Env):

metadata = {‚Äòrender.modes‚Äô: [‚Äòhuman‚Äô, ‚Äòrgb_array‚Äô]}

def render(self, mode=‚Äôhuman‚Äô):
if mode == ‚Äòrgb_array‚Äô:

return np.array(‚Ä¶) # return RGB frame suitable for video

elif mode == ‚Äòhuman‚Äô:

‚Ä¶ # pop up a window and render

else:

super(MyEnv, self).render(mode=mode) # just raise an exception

reset()[source]¬∂

reset the RL environment.

seed(seed=None)[source]¬∂

Sets the seed for this env‚Äôs random number generator(s).

Note

Some environments use multiple pseudorandom number generators. We want to capture all such seeds used in order to ensure that there aren‚Äôt accidental correlations between multiple generators.

Returns

Returns the list of seeds used in this env‚Äôs random

number generators. The first value in the list should be the ‚Äúmain‚Äù seed, or the value which a reproducer should pass to ‚Äòseed‚Äô. Often, the main seed equals the provided ‚Äòseed‚Äô, but this won‚Äôt be true if seed=None, for example.

Return type

list<bigint>

step(action)[source]¬∂

Take a step.

Parameters

action ‚Äì An action, or a sequence of actions. When multiple actions are provided the observation and reward are returned after running all of the actions.

Returns

A tuple of observation, reward, done, and info. Observation and reward are None if default observation/reward is not set. If done is True, observation and reward may also be None (e.g. because the service failed).
